physical_appearance:This teak chest is brown in colour. It has embroidered brass fittings in the colour gold
 along the sides and below the lid of the chest. There are 3 bolt like structures
 gold in colour
 on the top left corner and bottom  centre of the lid of the chest. The chest includes 2 pieces of furniture  with knob-like legs
 another plank of wood furniture and a key with a clover-like head.

 Dutch Colonial Chests Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie
sgcool_label_text:\This is an 18th century Dutch colonial teak chest with brass fittings
 with later mounted bun feet for use as furniture. Such chests were used by Dutch East India Company (VOC) officials for their travels. However
 the dimensions and number of chests carried per official was regulated
 with the Governor General permitted to take 18 chests of this \\five foot\\ size until 1791 when the permitted sizes were reduced.\

metadata.techniques_name: woodworking furniture making metalworking brass smithing
metadata.physical_appearance: This teak chest is brown in colour. It has embroidered brass fittings in the colour gold, along the sides and below the lid of the chest. There are 3 bolt like structures, gold in colour, on the top left corner and bottom  centre of the lid of the chest. The chest includes 2 pieces of furniture  with knob-like legs, another plank of wood furniture and a key with a clover-like head.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Furniture, Dutch Colonial Chests Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This is an 18th century Dutch colonial teak chest with brass fittings, with later mounted bun feet for use as furniture. Such chests were used by Dutch East India Company (VOC) officials for their travels. However, the dimensions and number of chests carried per official was regulated, with the Governor General permitted to take 18 chests of this ""five foot"" size until 1791 when the permitted sizes were reduced."
